messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Ridiculous amounts of emails
messages.msgSnippet: ... useful ... It depends on what you re using for email.  If you use Outlook Express, right click on Local Folders and then click new folder.  Make a folder
messages.messageBody:
> > How can I seperate my emails into different folders? This would be
useful
> inorder to keep personal and unschooling seperate.

It depends on what you're using for email. If you use Outlook Express,
right click on Local Folders and then click new folder. Make a folder for
each category you want. I make one for each list I'm on. Then click Tools,
Message Rules, and then Mail. Now you can set up your filters. Click New.
In #1, click where subject line contains specific words. In #2 click move
to specified folder. In #3 you click on the underlined words to edit them.
So for specified words, you'd click that and then type in
Unschooling-dotcom. Then click specified and choose which folder it will go
to.
Hope this helps.
Also, it would help everyone else if you delete everything but the specific
words you want to quote in your reply. (You left in all the yahoo baloney,
which we had to scroll past in order to get to your question.
Tia

"They that can give up essential liberty to obtain a little temporary
saftety deserve neither liberty nor safety." Ben Franklin
leschke@...

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Ridiculous amounts of emails
messages.msgSnippet: We ve always (except once) had just one address. Since I m the primary one who does email, it makes sense for us. For a while I maintained him a hotmail acct.
messages.messageBody:
We've always (except once) had just one address. Since I'm the primary
one who does email, it makes sense for us. For a while I maintained him
a hotmail acct. but that eventually went defunct.

In the unlikely event he gets email that's not also for me, or for joint
email, I'll call him to the computer.

:-) Diane

>I always wonder about people who don't have their own email address, but
>share one with a spouse. Maybe it is their only option. But every email
>account I've ever had (from the free to the very expensive) offers several
>accounts, so that every one in the family can have their own. You can also
>set up how your address appears to people who receive email from you.
>

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Re: Ridiculous amounts of emails
messages.msgSnippet: ... themselves as Mrs. _____ I always wonder about people who don t have their own email address, but share one with a spouse.  Maybe it is their only
messages.messageBody:
> Maybe it's just me, but I am always suspicious of anyone who refers to
themselves as "Mrs. _____">>>>>

I always wonder about people who don't have their own email address, but
share one with a spouse. Maybe it is their only option. But every email
account I've ever had (from the free to the very expensive) offers several
accounts, so that every one in the family can have their own. You can also
set up how your address appears to people who receive email from you.

My other life saver is to have all unschooling-dotcom email go into a
separate folder. Then I can arrange them by date received, or by subject,
or by person who sent it. Sometimes I need to delete hundreds of them at a
time, because I can't keep up. But it's easy, because they are all in one
folder.

Mary Ellen
